author: Sebastian Castelier
title: Record rainfall forces Gulf cities to rethink climate change - Al-Monitor: Independent, trusted coverage of the Middle East
text:
Subscribe to listen May 10, 2024 Several flights to and from Dubai International Airport were canceled May 2 as heavy rains and thunderstorms returned. Distance learning and work from home were advised in preparation for unstable weather across the United Arab Emirates.
This weather was less severe than the storm that hit the Gulf country last month. On April 16, a day after Dubai's major airport was named the world‚Äôs busiest international airport for the 10th consecutive year, the facility and its flooded runways became the face of the United Arab Emirates' worst rainfall on record.
More than 142 millimeters (5.6 inches) of rain fell in Dubai over a 24-hour period, paralyzing the Gulf‚Äôs business hub and leaving a wide swath of damage. In the days that followed, the UAE allocated $544 million to compensate Emiratis. Prime Minister Sheikh Mohammed bin Rashid al-Maktoum said the country has ‚Äú learned great lessons in dealing with severe rains .‚Äù
The flooding, described as ‚Äúa historic weather event‚Äù by the UAE news agency WAM, was a wake-up call for Gulf countries to revisit their exposure to climate risks. According to the United Nations‚Äô Intergovernmental Panel on Climate Change, global temperatures over land stood in 2011‚Äì2020 at 1.59¬∞C above pre-industrial levels, increasing the frequency and intensity of extreme weather events. The increase is causing heat waves in the Arabian Peninsula, shifting rainfall patterns, dust storms and tropical cyclones. The research network World Weather Attribution estimated that climate change made the Gulf deluge 10%-40% more intense than it would have been in the pre-industrial era.

author: Kevin Puga S.
title: Polic√≠a captura a presunto distribuidor de Magis TV en Ecuador
text:
La Polic\xeda Nacional captur\xf3 a un ciudadano que presuntamente distribu\xeda servicios de streaming ilegal en Ecuador a trav\xe9s de la plataforma Magis Tv .

 M\xe1s noticias 

La detenci\xf3n temporal de 24 horas se realiz\xf3 en una urbanizaci\xf3n de Daule, en la madrugada de este jueves 14 de noviembre de 2024, tras la orden de allanamiento que emiti\xf3 un juez en contra del individuo.

Las autoridades investigan al hombre por el delito de acceso no consentido a sistemas inform\xe1ticos y de telecomunicaciones. Fiscal\xeda presume que el detenido estaba detr\xe1s de la comercializaci\xf3n ilegal de miles de cuentas de Magis TV en Guayas.

La detenci\xf3n fue posible luego de que la Liga Espa\xf1ola de F\xfatbol , en conjunto con una cadena estadounidense que ofrece servicios de televisi\xf3n satelital en Ecuador, denunciara los hechos de la pirater\xeda del contenido.

El ciudadano habr\xeda dejado su ‘ huella digital ‘ tras registrar una de las tantas p\xe1ginas web que ten\xeda el servicio a su nombre, en mayo de 2023 .

Por este delito, la justicia de Ecuador podr\xeda sancionarlo con una pena de tres a cinco a\xf1os de prisi\xf3n.

 Ecuador y su lucha contra el streaming ilegal 
El presidente de la Liga Profesional de F\xfatbol del Ecuador (Liga Pro), Miguel \xc1ngel Loor , le declar\xf3 la “guerra” a los servicios ilegales de contenido digital .

“ Vamos a seguir en la lucha . El f\xfatbol ecuatoriano necesita crecer y que se pague lo que vale”, manifest\xf3 Loor en agosto de este a\xf1o.

“Seguiremos impulsando el bloque\xf3 de todas estas IP’s piratas , especialmente de Magis TV. Iremos hasta las \xfaltimas consecuencias porque es la \xfanica forma de revalorizar nuestro f\xfatbol”, recalc\xf3 en aquella ocasi\xf3n.

Seg\xfan datos mencionados por Liga Pro, ocho de cada 10 consumidores de f\xfatbo l visualizan los partidos locales y de la Selecci\xf3n en plataformas de contenido ilegal.

En el pa\xeds operar\xedan cerca de 100 de estos aplicativos de Internet Protocol TV ( IPTV ), seg\xfan la entidad.

 Magis TV y otros servidores, un problema regional 
Los perjuicios econ\xf3micos que produce Magis TV y otros distribuidores de contenido ilegal en Ecuador se replican tambi\xe9n en otros pa\xedses de la regi\xf3n.

En Colombia por ejemplo, el lunes 11 de noviembre fueron detenidos dos hermano s acusados de infringir los derechos de propiedad y transmisi\xf3n.

La Polic\xeda captur\xf3 a Juan Diego S. y Jos\xe9 Daniel S. en Pasto, \xd1ari\xf1o, ciudad cercana a la provincia de Tulc\xe1n, en el norte de Ecuador.

Los hombres recibieron una segunda acusaci\xf3n: robar datos de ‘clientes’ sin su consentimiento a trav\xe9s del aplicativo Magis TV y Magis Oficial .

En otros pa\xedses como Argentina, por ejemplo, la justicia tambi\xe9n ha intervenido. En septiembre de este a\xf1o, un juz de Buenos Aires dict\xf3 una sentencia con la que se orden\xf3 bloquear todos los dominios relacionados con este servicio ilegal de televisi\xf3n.

Adem\xe1s, se solicit\xf3 Google que impida el uso de la aplicaci\xf3n en su sistema operativo Android .

En una decisi\xf3n parecida tom\xf3 un juez de primera instancia en Espa\xf1a, en 2022

 LaLiga , encargada del f\xfatbol profesional en el pa\xeds europeo, estima que “si Google colaborase para vencer a la pirater\xeda, esta podr\xeda reducirse hasta en un 80 % “. Con informaci\xf3n de EFE .

author: Brian Neeley
title: NGOs launch legal challenge against Commission over glyphosate
text:
Environmental groups say the EU executive's renewal decision runs contrary to the latest scientific evidence.
Advertisement
A consortium of six NGOs is challenging the European Commission's ten-year extension of the approval of glyphosate, a spokesperson for Pesticide Action Network (PAN) Europe said during a press conference in Brussels today (January), claiming they That this decision fails to comply with EU law. 25).
Pan Europe, ClientEarth EU, Generation Futures, Global 2000, Pan Germany and Pan Netherlands presented their case to the EU Executive on 24 January, citing a number of recent scientific studies that ‚Äúwere ignored during the European Union‚Äù. [glyphosate] Approval process‚Äù, the spokesperson said.
The group claims these studies have shown that the notorious herbicide increases the risk of cancer and insect mortality, and has significant effects on brain and gene function.
Last November, the Commission renewed its approval of glyphosate use based on safety assessments by the European Food Safety Authority (EFSA) and the European Chemicals Agency (ECHA). However, both EU agencies are equally blamed by NGOs for ‚Äúnot paying enough attention to science‚Äù.
In the case of EFSA, the agency omitted data on the toxicity of glyphosate to insects in its peer review ‚Äì which, the group claims, industry data shows causes 100% mortality in some cases, the NGO said. Was accused.
According to a statement from Pan Europe, ‚ÄúThe Commission has acted against EU law on pesticide approvals and the precautionary principle by re-approving glyphosate despite evidence that the substance harms humans, animals and the environment.‚Äù Could.‚Äù
NGOs claimed that the EU assessment ‚Äúsystematically dismisses non-industry studies‚Äù, particularly from academics, whom the group said often compare the toxicity of pesticides to industry studies. But let's give more information.
According to NGOs, studies assessing cancer risk and how glyphosate might affect human organs were also rejected.
Despite a legal obligation to use the latest and reliable science, the consortium has accused the industry on several occasions of omitting key studies, with EU authorities turning a blind eye, preventing accurate and science-based assessment of pesticides' effectiveness. Compromise is being done properly.
Angelique Lissimachou, head of science and policy at Pan Europe, pointed out that autism spectrum disorders, Parkinson's disease, amyotrophic lateral sclerosis, microbiome and gut-brain effects are some of the key shortcomings that have been observed in the public scientific literature and ignored by the EU . Press conference.
‚ÄúThe re-authorization of glyphosate for 10 years by the European Commission, in collusion with France and other Member States, is a humanitarian, environmental and democratic disaster,‚Äù said MEP Manon Aubry (France/The Left). Advocated for and ignored countless evidence of severe poisoning.‚Äù
‚ÄúThis ignores the opposition expressed by 70% of Europeans against European laws on glyphosate and hazardous substances,‚Äù Aubry said.
Stefan de Keersmaeker, the European Commission's spokesperson for the European Green Deal and public health and food safety, said the decision was based on ‚Äústrong science and evidence‚Äù from ECHA and EFSA, and added that the EU executive ‚Äúwill respond‚Äù to the NGOs. ' The legal challenge followed a ‚Äúthorough analysis of the claims‚Äù.

author: The Community Post
title: Jolly Results Launches Specialized Digital Marketing Services for HVAC, Plumbing, and Roofing Contractors Across the U.S. | User | minstercommunitypost.com
text:
Jolly Results, a newly launched digital marketing agency, is making waves in the home services industry with its exclusive focus on HVAC, plumbing, and roofing contractors across the United States. After more than eight years of behind-the-scenes experience working as SEO specialists for established marketing agencies, the team at Jolly Results is stepping out on its own with a promise: to deliver fast, effective, and lead-driven marketing solutions tailored to the needs of home service professionals.
Built from the ground up to understand the unique challenges of local contractors, Jolly Results offers a complete digital growth package that includes professional website design, Local SEO, and Google & Local Services Ads (LSA) and has been designed to generate consistent leads and help contractors dominate their local markets.
‚ÄúWe‚Äôre not here to offer generic websites or cookie-cutter campaigns,‚Äù a company spokesperson said. ‚ÄúEverything we create is built for speed, performance, and the specific needs of HVAC techs, roofers, and plumbers who rely on leads to keep their business running.‚Äù
Through a simplified four-step process: audit, launch, generate, and scale, Jolly Results brings results in record time. Websites go live within seven days, ads start generating leads within 24 to 48 hours, and Local SEO campaigns begin showing results within the first 30 to 60 days.
Real contractors are already seeing the difference. In Phoenix, an HVAC company reported a 340% increase in leads and tripled their revenue within eight months. A Dallas roofing contractor generated $2.8 million in new business from storm-related Google Ads campaigns. And in Denver, a plumbing contractor now ranks #1 for high-intent local search terms like ‚Äúemergency plumber near me,‚Äù thanks to Jolly Results‚Äô Local SEO strategy.
Jolly Results offers customized solutions for each trade. HVAC websites highlight emergency contact features and seasonal services. Plumbing campaigns focus on emergency repairs, water heater installations, and trust-building content. Roofing strategies are optimized around storm damage, insurance claims, and urgent roof repairs. Each campaign is carefully designed to address the real-time needs and search behaviors of homeowners in the contractor‚Äôs local area.
More than just another marketing agency, Jolly Results is positioning itself as a long-term partner to contractors who are serious about scaling. Its service packages are priced transparently, with websites starting at $1,497, Local SEO at $997/month, and Google/LSA Ads at $1,497/month, and include full strategy, implementation, and ongoing optimization.
‚ÄúOur mission is simple,‚Äù said the company's spokesperson. ‚ÄúWe help home service businesses generate more leads, close more jobs, and grow their revenue faster, without the runaround.‚Äù
Contractors interested in working with Jolly Results can start with a free marketing audit and consultation to assess their current online presence and get a tailored strategy for local market domination.
About Jolly Results
Jolly Results is a U.S.-based digital marketing agency built exclusively for HVAC, plumbing, and roofing contractors. With years of experience and deep industry specialization, Jolly Results helps home service businesses grow their lead flow, improve their visibility, and increase revenue through data-driven websites, SEO, and Google Ads campaigns.
To learn more, visit www.jollyresults.com .

author: Gateway Grizzlies
title: Grizzlies Allow One Hit, But Lose at Lake Erie
text:
Grizzlies Allow One Hit, But Lose at Lake Erie
August 29, 2024 -
Frontier League (FL) Gateway Grizzlies News Release
Avon, Ohio - The Gateway Grizzlies did not allow the Lake Erie Crushers a single hit until there were two outs in the bottom of the eighth inning on Thursday night, but the one hit they did allow was a go-ahead, two-run triple by Vincent Byrd, Jr. in a 4-2 loss at Crushers Stadium.
It was a combined effort by the Grizzlies' staff, as Deylen Miley struck out four in his three innings pitched to end 2024 with 161 on the year, the second-most in a single season by an individual pitcher in Frontier League history. Kaleb Hill would toss the next three innings, and Justin Goossen-Brown retired the side in the seventh.
The game itself was back-and-forth again, as Lake Erie took a 1-0 lead with an unearned run on an RBI groundout by Jake Guenther in the second inning before Gateway responded on a two-out RBI single by Victor Castillo in the top of the third. The Grizzlies then went ahead 2-1 in the next inning on another two-out RBI hit by Tate Wargo, but two leadoff walks by Hill in the bottom half led to a Guenther sac fly, tying the game again.
It remained 2-2 until the eighth inning, and after the Grizzlies had runners at first and third base with one out, as well as the bases loaded with two outs but failing to score in the top of the eighth, Keegan Collett (0-1) came in for the bottom half, and retired the first two batters he faced. But Alberti Chavez would reach on an error by Abdiel Diaz and Scout Knotts would follow with a walk, bringing up Byrd, who fell behind 0-2 before hitting a fly ball to left-center field that Castillo nearly caught for the final out of the frame. But it dropped out of his glove for the Crushers' first (and, as it turned out) only hit of the game, scoring the go-ahead runs and making the score 4-2.
The Grizzlies would get a runner on base in the ninth inning on an error, bringing the tying run to the plate, but would not be able to score in suffering just their second series loss since the end of June. They will look to bounce back this weekend in the final series of the regular season at home against the Florence Y'alls at Grizzlies Ballpark. First pitch of the series opener is set for tomorrow, August 30, at 6:30 p.m. CT in Sauget.
Gateway Grizzlies Statistics
‚Ä¢ Discuss this story on the
Frontier League message board...

text:

La investigaci√≥n result√≥ en la cumplimentaci√≥n de una orden de aprehensi√≥n contra el presunto agresor.
San Quint√≠n, BC.- La Fiscal√≠a General del Estado, a trav√©s de la Agencia Estatal de Investigaci√≥n, llev√≥ a cabo la detenci√≥n de un individuo acusado de feminicidio en grado de tentativa y violencia familiar en San Quint√≠n.
Las labores realizadas a trav√©s de la Fiscal√≠a Especializada en Delitos Contra Mujeres por Raz√≥n de G√©nero llevaron a la emisi√≥n de una orden de aprehensi√≥n en contra de Mario Francisco ‚ÄúN‚Äù, sustentada en evidencia recabada en la carpeta de investigaci√≥n.

author: Massimo Costa
title: Kimi Antonelli, incidente al debutto (dopo 3 giri) con la Mercedes a Monza. Nelle prove libere 1 Verstappen davanti a Leclerc
text:
MOTORSPORT FORMULA 1 Kimi Antonelli, incidente al debutto (dopo 3 giri) con la Mercedes a Monza. Nelle prove libere 1 Verstappen davanti a Leclerc LA RICERCA Aci-Censis, Gp Monza vale 142 milioni di euro. Imola 85. Ricadute su sistema produttivo italiano per 80 milioni FORMULA 1 Monza, Antonelli a 18 anni debutta con la Mercedes a fianco del futuro ferrarista Hamilton PER MARCA FORMULA 1 Kimi Antonelli, incidente al debutto (dopo 3 giri) con la Mercedes a Monza. Nelle prove libere 1 Verstappen davanti a Leclerc ENDURANCE WEC: il BoP penalizza Toyota e Porsche ad Austin, Ferrari e Lamborghini alleggerite FORMULA 1 McLaren imita Red Bull, √® Norris il nuovo cannibale. Ferrari d√† segnali di guerra in vista di Monza
C'era tanta attesa, forse anche troppa, per la prima volta di Andrea Kimi Antonelli nella FP1 di Monza con la Mercedes. Il giovane bolognese , che nelle prossime ore dovrebbe essere annunciato come pilota del team diretto da Toto Wolff al fianco di George Russell per la stagione 2025, √® entrato in pista tenendo subito un ritmo elevato, utilizzando anche gomme soft. Ma dopo appena tre giri cronometrati, cinque in totale, all'ingresso della Parabolica forse affrontata con troppa velocit√†, ha perso il posteriore della sua W15, si √® girato, e con una certa violenza ha sbattuto contro le protezioni.
Monza, Antonelli a 18 anni debutta con la Mercedes a fianco del futuro ferrarista Hamilton
 Non certo una bella figura e non ricordiamo un pilota al debutto nella FP1 finire subito fuori pista. Ma tant'√®, √® andata male, pu√≤ accadere e Antonelli avr√† altre occasioni e non sar√† certo questo incidente a segnare il suo futuro. Intanto, proseguir√† a lavorare nei test privati con la Mercedes 2022, 25 i giorni di test programmati per lui, di questi ne ha gi√† svolti parecchi. Preoccupato, invece, George Russell, quasi sbiancato nel vedere la sua monoposto, ceduta per l'occasione ad Antonelli, pesantemente danneggiata alla Parabolica.
Not the FP1 outing that Kimi Antonelli was looking for üòî #F1 #ItalianGP pic.twitter.com/KmEHF8Ewv8
‚Äî Formula 1 (@F1) August 30, 2024 Con l'asfalto bello fresco e i cordoli bassi che richiedono maggiore aggressivit√†, i piloti hanno preso confidenza con queste novit√† e alla fine della sessione, dopo la bandiera rossa per l'incidente di Antonelli, √® emerso Max Verstappen con la Red Bull-Honda in 1'21"676. Una bella risposta del team diretto da Christian Horner, anche se siamo soltanto all'inizio di un lungo weekend, rispetto alla perdita di quella competitivit√† che aveva caratterizzato l'inizio di stagione e le due precedenti stagioni.
Gp Monza, l' ‚ÄúAnello della Regina‚Äù per chi far√† la pole. Gioiello in oro con bandiera a scacchi e il tricolore italiano
Verstappen ha preceduto di 228 millesimi Charles Leclerc con una Ferrari che presenta alcune novit√† al fondo e per il monegasco un motore nuovo. Carlos Sainz aveva battezzato una nuova power unit a Zandvoort. Lo spagnolo stamane ha colto il quarto tempo. Tra le due Ferrari, si √® inserita la temutissima McLaren-Mercedes di Lando Norris mentre Oscar Piastri ha concluso sesto. Notevole la prestazione della Sauber-Ferrari, quinta con Valtteri Bottas.
Lewis Hamilton √® risultato settimo con la Mercedes, bene la Williams-Mercedes, ottava con Alexander Albon. Una buona sessione l'ha fatta il debuttante assoluto Franco Colapinto che in Williams ha preso il posto di Logan Sargeant. L'argentino, che arriva dalla Formula 2 dove occupava il sesto posto, √® risultato 17esimo prendendo confidenza con la monoposto, che aveva saggiato nella FP1 di Silverstone, senza commettere errori.
A completare la top 10, Sergio Perez, con la seconda Red Bull e lontano dal compagno di squadra, e Fernando Alonso con la Aston Martin-Mercedes. Buon avvio per la Haas-Ferrari, che ha differenziato il lavoro tra Kevin Magnussen, 11esimo, e Nico Hulkenberg, 19esimo. Bene anche Daniel Ricciardo, 12esimo con la Racing Bulls-Honda, di poco davanti al compagno Yuki Tsunoda.
Venerd√¨ 30 agosto 2024, libere 1
